lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. announced yesterday that the latest federal graduation rates showed that athletes were more likely than the general student body to earn a diploma. The latest measurements showed incoming athletes from the freshman class of 1999-2000 had a graduation rate of 63 percent, compared with 61 percent for students who did not play sports. Athletes also had a 1-point increase over last year. The N.C.A.A. said that in the past four years, female athletes earned diplomas at a higher rate (71 percent) than their male counterparts (56), and that blacks (53) and Hispanics (58) still lagged behind other ethnic groups. White athletes graduated at a rate of 67 percent.
